page.title: 16ASHWELL FIELD STUDIES CENTRE
page.content:
During school terms Ashwell village is often busy with school children carrying out local environmental research.They come from schools all over Hertfordshire and are based at the{Old Merchant Taylor's School}in Mill Lane.The Victorian schoolrooms now serve as the County Council's Field Studies Centre. Ashwell is small enough for children to survey quite easily.Many buildings are historically interesting and the{ {Museum}and{medieval graffitti }in the Church are worth a visit.The village is also useful because of its natural springs at the foot of a chalk ridge.
Local people have mixed views about the Centre.The children are mostly made welcome but some people think that they are a bit of a nuisance!! { }
